Title.evidence: Neural Mechanisms of Pain-Depression Comorbidity in Postherpetic Neuralgia: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised controlled trial included 17 depressed PHN patients, 19 non-depressed PHN patients, and 34 healthy controls (HCs)

Participants.evidence: Conducted at the Second Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University School of Medicine, this randomised controlled trial included 17 depressed PHN patients, 19 non-depressed PHN patients, and 34 healthy controls (HCs). Participants were right-handed and diagnosed with PHN.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to elucidate the neural mechanisms underlying pain-depression comorbidity in PHN patients.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the difference in fALFF values in the right temporal lobe (TL) and its connectivity with the inferior frontal gyrus (IFG) over a 5-minute scan period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: randomised controlled trial included 17 depressed PHN patients, 19 non-depressed PHN patients, and 34 healthy controls (HCs)

Result_Outcome.evidence: One-way analysis of covariance showed significant differences in fALFF values in the right TL and its connectivity with the IFG among the three groups.
